meanings.definition: To cause to lose balance or stability.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was overbalancing the tall tree.
meanings.sent2: She tripped on a rock, overbalancing and falling to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept overbalancing the stack of books.
meanings.sent4: His sudden outburst of laughter overbalanced his serious demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The acrobat's daring act involved overbalancing on a tightrope.

meanings.definition: To outweigh or exceed in importance or influence.
meanings.sent1: The safety of the passengers overbalanced the need for speed in the decision-making process.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness overbalanced any flaws she may have had.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies overbalanced the unpleasant smell of burnt toast.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the discovery overbalanced all previous scientific theories.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset overbalanced the chaos of the city streets.
